Revelations 8 Solve

This cipher was took 3,451 days to solve!

This cipher went unsolved from September 6, 2016 until February 17, 2026, spanning 3,451 days.

Congratulations to randomiser71 for solving this cipher! This is the longest time taken to solve a cipher in the history of the series (beating GK 12 by just 9 days), and it is a testament to the difficulty of this cipher.

61 34 30 34 37 31 65 39 34 35 38 39 62 33 62 63 39 34 34 32 36 39 63 38 65 0d 0a
Length: 4610 characters

Solution

Section titled “Solution”
  • Credit to randomiser71 for solving this cipher!

Important notes

Section titled “Important notes”
The algorithms described in this solution are using a deprecated PHP library called "mcrypt". This library uses CFB8 instead of nCFB (as pretty much all modern tools use). Because of this distinction, you cannot actually solve these ciphers using modern libraries or tools like CyberChef. You need to find a library or tool that supports cfb8. There is one website in particular that does support it, which you can find here.

Steps

Section titled “Steps”

Step 1: Insert a missing “63” between the 131st and 132nd bigram. This was likely deleted on accident when transcribing into the texture in game.

Step 2: Decode from hexadecimal.

Step 3: Reverse the resulting hexadecimal string and convert from hex to base64.

Step 4: Blowfish-compat (CFB) decrypt with key “Zombies” and hexadecimal IV 30303030303030303030303030303030.

Step 5: Decode the result from base64.

Plaintext

Section titled “Plaintext”

Final entry: I have run out of pages for this journal so it seems fitting that this is my last entry. I am leaving the house today for good, and I dont think I will ever return. Father has been gone for many years now, and I miss him. I think of him often. Monty says he is not dead but has just evolved into a new form. I guess you can say that Monty is my father now, really the father to all of us kids that grew up at the house. We know the sacrifices that were made to get us here and keep us safe. I will always love them for that. A debt that can never be repaid. Monty was going to take me to the lake today to go swimming. I love floating in the water with the warm sun dancing on the surface and watching the clouds slowly pass overhead. Sometimes I think I see father in those clouds looking down at me and I smile-I know he will always be with me. Samantha
